description: Here, the first "adventure" game continues to be ported to the latest and greatest platforms as a "hello world" exercise of sorts. Not much has changed for this game in the past 35-odd years, so to briefly reiterate: the player directs the actions of a spelunking cave-adventurer through a primitive text parser, overcoming monsters, traps and strange obstacles with the use of handy inventory items and head-scratching magic words. This version is a very faithful reproduction, maintaining the gold standard of 430 points to achieve after Don Woods had souped up Will Crowther's sun source. Android being what it is, some relatively new functionality for this text adventure is the option of using speech synthesis and voice recognition to verbally spar with the game.
title: Colossal Cave Adventure

description: Tronic is not purely a game but rather an interactive live wallpaper. It's essentially a variant of the Tron-like light cycles genre. Viewed from a top down perspective the player takes control of a light cycle and has to stay alive as long as possible without crashing into the tails of the other light cycles that speeds around the screen. The aim is simply to get a score as high as possible. The game can be played with both touch and accelerator controls.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying not to crash into the other cycles
Usually it doesn't take long before a crash occurs

title: Tronic

description: In Greek mythology Styx was the river between Earth and the Underworld. In this mobile puzzle game the player helps the ferryman to transport the souls of the dead over the river and into the kingdom of Hades. This is not as easy at it sounds since the river is full of barriers that block the path for the ferryman. The aim of the game is to clear a passage through the river so that the ferryman can row his boat from shore to shore. The gameplay works like a sliding puzzle, similar to the board game Rush Hour, and the player uses the touch screen to drag the barriers around the playing field. For each movement made the player has to pay a coin to Hades but for each completed level he is awarded 100 coins. After completing the game the player can compare his score to others on a global high score list.

sample_screenshots.caption: First level is an easy one
For each level there is less and less space to move within

title: The Styx

description:
Based on the 1995 shareware fighting game Champions of Zulula. Heroes of Zulula is a strategy RPG in which you control a ragtag band of ex-gladiators (tournaments are now banned) who seek to banish the evil Akolan from the city. A lot of the character archetypes from Champions are back. Like most strategy RPG you control armies on a strategic map in a turn-based fashion. When units engage in combat, however, the game switches to a rather original combat mode. The typical "run towards my enemy, slash, return to starting position" is replaced with a combat planning/strategy interface. You deploy your troops and give them order, then you press play and watch the combat unfold in a sort of "simulation".

Most of the characters are new and loosely based on their 1995 counterparts. Emphasis is placed on the story, which has a "Trailer Park Boys meet South Park" sort of vibe. So the typical medieval-fantasy bunch is replaced by a slow-poke cyclop, a french knight, a french-canadian slime (who only speaks pure Quebec joual, even in the english version), a chatroom l33t-speaking eye, a straight-man dog, an robotic stone golem, a run-of-the-mill mage and a mercenary snake. The game was voluntarily rated "Teen Content" for Strong Language, Cartoon Violence, Crass Humour and Alcohol Use. It is not for the easily offended.

The game has 10 acts, there is a free ad-supported version and an ad-free version which has a few more features. 2 sequels are already planned.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the sewers we meet a French speaking slimey
Oh no, this doesn't look to good

title: Heroes of Zulula

description:
Winds of Steel is a game for the Android systems that places the player in a position of a pilot during the Second World War, in the campaign the player can choose between several battles such as "Pearl Harbor" or "Tokyo" where he has to complete his objectives in order to complete the mission, objectives are often standard ones like "defend this area", "destroy that target" or "scan that zone". Each mission has its own aircraft that belongs to either the Axis or the Allies forces, the player can not choose which faction to play as. At the end of the mission the player sees his score and he can then replay the mission at any time to see if he can beat his highest score. Beside a Campaign there is also an "instant action" mode where the player can choose an objective without any connection to a historic battle.

The player controls the aircraft by tilting his phone like he is holding a steering wheel, this way the player can fly in any direction and change his altitude. To fire the player must touch the "Fire" button located on the right side of the screen, beneath the fire button is a button that allows the player to switch to his secondary weapons (this is almost always bombs), after switching the player can use his secondary weapon the same way he used his primary weapon. Some missions will start the player out on the ground and to start flying the player will have to touch the fire button to start his engines. If the player is fired at he will eventually lose control of his aircraft and crash, meaning that the mission has ended and that he has lost.
title: Winds of Steel

description:
In iRunner the player takes control over Mr. I, a yellow character with a feather on his head whose goal is to run to a mysterious destination. The goal is to make it through an obstacle course by jumping over and sliding under obstacles such as; gaps, fire, platforms and lamps. More often then not the player also has to complete a certain goal such as collecting a certain number of batteries. The player can also collect gifts that contain clothing, if all four different type of gifts have been collected Mr. I goes into a fever mode which makes him go faster and get double the points he normally would.

Besides story mode there is also a Quick Play mode where the player has to complete certain objectives for starts and a challenge mode where the player has to survive for as long as possible. The controls are rather simple: Mr. I constantly runs in the middle of the screen and there are buttons reading "Slide" and "Jump" in the bottom right and left, tapping the buttons makes Mr. I perform that ability and if well timed avoid the hazards in front of him. The player must also collect batteries to complete objectives or increase the character's speed, collecting enough of them will return one of Mr. I's two hearts. Losing all the hearts and getting hit one more time afterwards results in a game-over and the player has to retry the stage again.
title: iRunner

description: Slider is an abstract puzzle game. Players tilt the device to slide coloured blocks around a board. When four blocks of the same colour form a square, they turn into a big block. Big blocks can be tapped to clear them. The game's four modes include a puzzle mode where the player must clear pre-designed puzzles, a timed mode where the board continuously fills with blocks and the player has a minute to get the highest score he can, a strategy mode where there is no time limit but a block is added to the board each time it is tilted, and an endless mode with no game over condition.
title: Slider

description: Help Out is based on the concept of the board game Rush Hour. It is a block sliding puzzle game where the player is presented with a board full of rectangular blocks. A certain number of these blocks should be removed from the board and to do this the player has to slide the blocks around so that a clear path is created. The player can customize the game with different themes that change the look of the game. When starting out there are three different themes to choose from, but as the player progresses through the game more are unlocked. The game feature hundreds of levels. By completing levels the player can earn achievements and bonuses (gems). If things get to tricky the game really can help out the player by showing the solution. This is however limited to once per every 30 minutes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out with an easy one

title: Help Out

description:
Fruit Slice is a reflex based game inspired by Fruit Ninja in which players must slice pieces of fruit with a sword as they appear on screen by swiping their finger across the touch screen in order to score points. However the player must be careful not to slice any bombs that appear on screen, as this entails the end of the game.

In addition to the standard Classic game mode, there are three other modes that can be played. First is Time Mode in which the player has a finite amount of I me to slice as much fruit as possible. The second is One Shot Mode, that gives the player one sword swing in order to slice as many pieces of fruit as possible. The last is Pipeline Mode, in which players must slice different type of fruit in a specific order.
title: Fruit Slice

description: Atomic Bomber is set in the Cold War, and gives the player control of a NATO jet that has to bomb several Soviet targets such as Jeeps, missile sites and buildings within several levels. The player's Jet is in constant motion, and the player controls it by pressing a location on the touch screen to make the plane go in that direction. The player releases bombs by pressing the bomb release button on the left hand side of the screen. To hinder the player, the Soviets will be using MIG jets, AA cannons and SAM sites to bring down the player. The players basic ammunition payload consists of basic free fall bombs, but during the course of the levels, these can be augmented with new bombs including cluster bombs and, of course, nuclear bombs.

sample_screenshots.caption: In addition to nuclear pick ups, players will also get regular bomb enhancements.
...But soon, AA emplacements and enemy MiG's will crop up....
...But never fear, nukes will be swiftly available...
Atomic Bomber stars off easy enough, with only light vehicles and a building to blow up...

title: Atomic Bomber

description: Skater Boy is a side-scrolling obstacle course with automatic scrolling. The game is divided into several scenes with 30 levels in each scene. The goal of each level is to simply reach the end of the course, however achievements are awarded for flawless skating, amassing a large number of points and getting all gold goblets. The skater boy is controlled by two on-screen buttons: the left one is used to accelerate, the right one to jump.
title: Skater Boy

alternate_titles.title: The Funky Chicken Who Thought He Was A Ninja

description:
Ninja Chicken is a simple platform game with automatic scrolling. As a chicken you run from left to right avoiding obstacles and trying to reach certain goals, i.e. collect a number of acorns or silver coins, lay a number of eggs, run a certain distance (or any combination of these goals). The players will earn gold coins that can be used to unlock bonus levels.

The game is integrated into PlayScape - an online system that lets the players view their stats and spend coins earned in Ninja Chicken to buy upgrades and items for other games already present in PlayScape.
title: Ninja Chicken

alternate_titles.title: aliEnd: For All Your Extraterrestrial Extermination Needs

description: aliEnd is a 2D arcade game in which the player runs, jumps, and fires missiles on the surface of a planet in an attempt to clear the alien infestations. It makes use of the touch screen and accelerometer allowing players to flick to fire missiles, tap to jump, and tilt to run around the surface. The game camera ensures that the player is always at the top of the screen and the planet seems to rotate underneath. After a missile is fired, the player is able to run back and forth to guide the missile to its target. There are two versions of the game. Next to the International Edition there is a US edition that supports the rewards network Kiip.

sample_screenshots.caption: Screenshot of gameplay in one of the later levels.
Screenshot of gameplay in one of the first levels.
Screenshot of gameplay in one of the later levels.

title: aliEnd

description: Dino Picker is a game where the player controls a spaceship by tilting the device in the direction it needs to be moved. The goal is to abduct dinosaurs by hovering over them. Each abduction is awarded with points. It consists of three levels. In the first one, Sand Dunes, dinos can simply be abducted by touching anywhere on the screen while on top of them. In the second level, Dark Forest, the gameplay is identical, but the animals can now shoot fireballs towards the ship. The third one, Deep Space, has more complex navigation, but the same challenge of pickups and escape.
title: Dino Picker

description: Moon's Revival is a 2D side-scrolling platform game where the player controls the little warrior Ibn. When the moon disappears one day, Tubba, the elder, promises his daughter for the one who can bring it back. The game starts at the gate of the village. A virtual D-pad in the bottom left corner is used to guide the character. A jump button is used to cross obstacles and arrows can be fired at enemies by tapping the right side of the screen. Every level ends with a tree of pumpkins. They need to be shot to move on to the next stage.
title: Moon's Revival

description:
GravBlocks is, on the surface, a traditional match-three style puzzle game in a similar vein to Tetris Attack or Bejeweled. In this sense, players simply switch blocks that are side-by-side either left or right. The main difference is a new focus and gimmick to the gameplay. Rather than building high scores by crafting combos when clearing blocks, GravBlocks focuses on strategic gameplay. The strategy comes in the form of Gravity Blocks in the play area. Players earn a score multiplier by aligning Gravity Blocks to change the gravity of the play area. The left-right block switching mechanic updates relative to gravity. For instance, when gravity is against the left wall of the play space, the switching mechanic feels more like "up-down," but is really still "left-right" per the current gravity. Bomb blocks exist and when used, will clear all of one (or more, if used carefully) color of block from the play space.

Changing gravity can be more challenging than it may seem. The walls of the play area are filled with potential hazards, and if even one block falls into the play area, the Multiplier is reset. Using rare Wild blocks, players can temporarily close hazards so that changing gravity can be performed safely. In this sense, players must be able to both act quickly when switching blocks, and be able to monitor and plan their strategies. In Intermediate and Advanced difficulties, the score multiplier can reach x10.

This formula is then utilized in the game's four different modes. Challenge mode is a "traditional" Tetris-like endeavor, with blocks falling into the play space with gradually increasing numbers falling in. Players may choose from 30 difficulty levels, and the length of each level can be selected from 1 to 5 minutes with a goal of lasting as long as possible and building as big a score as possible. Over the course of the game, more Destruction Hazards gradually open in the walls.

Destruction mode is a race against time. Players are simply tasked with clearing the stage of blocks as quickly as possible--by dropping them into Hazards. No score is kept, only time is recorded. Here, the Wild block, rather than closing all Hazards, will open all the hazards in one wall--which means that a player may change gravity and drop every single block into the open wall of destruction.

Zen mode is identical to Challenge mode, except that players select any of the 30 difficulty levels and play on that level as long as they want. The difficulty never advances in this mode, so it's the place where players can just zone out clearing blocks, or hone their skills.

Puzzle mode uses the same gameplay concepts (except Wild blocks), but uses it to challenge players in a different way. There are 100 puzzles in the game and these feature stacks of blocks that must be cleared in a set number of moves. For instance, the first 40 puzzles can all be solved by making a single move somewhere in the game space. Difficulty gradually advances and the first set of puzzles simply utilize ordinary blocks, then incorporate Gravity blocks, then Bomb blocks, and finally, both Gravity and Bombs are incorporated in the puzzles together.

GravBlocks also features 60 Achievements (unlocking these is key to unlocking additional block and background graphics) and Leaderboards.
title: GravBlocks

description: Tiny Flowers is a pattern puzzle game with flowers. The game consists of a board that is always completely filled with flowers of different varieties and colours in a 7x12 pattern. Each session lasts one minute and the player needs to create as many matches as possible by tapping groups of three flowers of the same kind. No straight horizontal or vertical lines need to be formed, as long as the flowers are connected horizontally or vertically. Swapping flowers is not a gameplay element, only spotting the matches. When a match is created, it disappears from the board and new flowers drop down from the top. When quick matches are formed, a combo chain is started. When the game is over the final score is displayed and the best ones are stored in a highscore listed. During gameplay a single piece of classical music is played. Dynamic advertisements are displayed on the results and the highscore screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: A game in progress: there are many possible matches.
Game Over and the final score
Three quick matches and the combos start.

title: Tiny Flowers

description: Spare Phoenix is an endless vertically-oriented platform jumper similar to Doodle Jump. The player controls a phoenix that jumps up automatically. The device has to be tilted left or right through the accelerometer functionality to move the bird left or right. As long as a new platform is reached with a jump, the game goes on. When the bird drops down from the bottom of the screen, it always rises—true to its legacy—from its ashes as a new egg hatches immediately. The score and difficulty are however reset.

sample_screenshots.caption: Jumping up is the only way to go.
Main menu with localized ads. There are no ads during gameplay.

title: Spare Phoenix

description:
Army Sniper puts the player in the role of an elite army marksman tasked with taking out terrorists. The player aims by tapping in the area of a terrorist to zoom in using the sniper scope, then tilting the device to get the exact aim, and selecting the fire button to fire.

In addition to the game's story mode, there is also an endless mode that allows players to take out as many terrorists as the player wants. Both of the modes have three different difficulties: easy, medium and hard.
title: Army Sniper

description:
Mr. Legs present's one long-legged man's journey across a stark black and white 1920's cartoon style landscape in search of cherries and social mobility. Mr. Leg's is a notable cherry picker in the Deserts of Londonium, he owes his succeeds to his unusual legs, capable of growing longer or shrinking to nothing in a moment. The wold he traverses is dangerous, deserts filled with malevolent crows, haunted mansions, cities where bombs litter the street... but it is worth it for the prestige of cherry picking.

Mr. Legs will walk determinedly to the right and it up to the player to alter the length of Mr. Legs' legs. The characters height is crucial to be able to snag berries or avoid crows. Another standard hazard are time bombs. These can be detonated at a safe distance before they explode on Mr. Legs by tapping them, sometime bombs can be exploded to get rid of enemies or obstacles. If an explosion, enemy, or obstacle hits Mr. Legs he will disgorge some of his collected fruits, should he not have any fruits the level will end. There are nine areas to traverse, and they are unlocked if players collect enough cherries in the area preceding. Up to three stars per area are awarded to the player based on how many out of all fruit on the stage the player managed to get to the end of the area with, getting all the stars in both difficult settings (easy/hard) is the goal of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Moving on up! This hat should lend Mr. Legs a fitting air of respectability.
A pill will speed up Mr. Legs - it looks like he has four legs.
Going with the flow of aerial traffic.
Mr. Legs loses some teeth in a terrifying accident with explosives.
Bad weather, with a chance of crows.

title: Mr. Legs

description: Små Bokstaver is a Norwegian spelling game where the players needs to spell the correct word based on a drawing. There are three different difficulty levels.
title: Små Bokstaver

description: In this simulation of the air hockey arcade game the player controls a mallet trying to hit he puck into the opponent's goal. The game is played until seven goals are scored (Classic mode) or until the timer reaches zero (Timed mode). There are three difficulty settings. A variety of color choices for the playfield and the puck are available. The game supports two-player versus matches on a single device.
title: Air Hockey

description:
7x7 is a tile-matching puzzle game. The title refers to the size of the board where tiles of five different colours appear with each turn. The goal of the game is to survive as long as possible by creating matching lines with four tiles of the same colour, horizontally, vertically or diagonally. At the first level three new tiles appear per turn. With each turn the player has one opportunity to create a match by dragging a tile around anywhere on the board as long as there is an unobstructed path. When a match is created, the tiles disappear. The new tiles that appear with each new turn have a random colour and a random placement on the board. When a successful match is made, the player has another opportunity to move another tile and create a match, before a new turn is started. It is also possible to create matches of up to seven tiles, by connecting two three-tile groups for instance.

The game consists of four levels. In the first one three tiles appear per turn, in the second four tiles etc. The goal is to survive as long as possible and a certain amount of matches are needed to progress to the next level. Any move can be undone with a button in the top right corner. By creating combos a power-up can be earned to move a tile anywhere on the board, even when the path is not clear.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using the power-up you can move the blue tile, even when it is surrounded.
Almost out of options in the second level

title: 7x7

description: S.M.T.H., short for Send Me to Heaven, is a sports game that challenges the player to throw his phone or tablet in the air as high as possible. Entirely designed around the accelerometer, the device registers the height. The player can go for a personal best, or share the result worldwide. Results are stored in a daily, weekly and world top 10. By enabling the device's GPS function it is possible to take part in local competitions. Of course, the developer claims no responsibility when the device is damaged while playing the game. The game is described as a pervasive video game, where the actual action is leaving the gadget and leaking into reality.
title: S.M.T.H.: Send Me to Heaven

description:
Joyful Executions is a strategy game that satirizes the propaganda of the North Korean government. Players control Kim Bok Kyong, a young girl who is a North Korean commissar that commands the firing squad punishing traitors. The game consists of different rounds with multiple waves for each one. A wave consists of a number of traitors positioned in front of the firing squad. The main goal is to survive as long as possible and that depends on the approval of the divine leader who rates the performance.

There are four types of characters that can appear in front of the squad and the expected enemies are shown before starting the round. On the right side of the screen a weapon can be chosen. It also displays the remaining waves and ammo. The player has to assess the type and amount of enemies taking into account the limited supply of ammo to instruct the squad of four soldiers to shoot by clicking a Fire icon. There is also a time limit and when it takes too long the wave passes and the enemies remain for the next wave. The round can also be lost when the court is entirely filled up with enemies. Each round has a number of random events, such as double damage, weapon jamming or a soldier dropping out. After each round the performance is rated.

When performing badly, an optional mini game can be played after finishing the round. It shows Kim Bok Kyong in the court with a number of shot enemies lying on the ground. She has to wait until a survivor raises his hand begging for mercy and then quickly tap his hand to shoot. When the mini game is lost, the approval rating goes down even more.

By performing well money is earned that can be spent in an in-game shop. Some of the weapons are a rifle, a machine gun, grenades etc., but each with limited ammo. Ammo needs to be bought and weapons can be upgraded, for instance providing more damage or a larger ammo capacity. The type of weapon has to be assessed and some are more effective against specific types of enemies than others. The game is entirely free to play without in-app purchases.

sample_screenshots.caption: The leader is not so happy this time.
Overview of the four types of enemies

title: Joyful Executions

description:
Rising Empires is a strategic, single-player 4X civilization game. The focus is on the strategic level: positioning of units, settlements and holding of territory play a major part. Besides that the game has an element of civilization building with a choice of technology advances to develop that gives all different kinds of more or less necessary improvements. You compete against other computer-controlled empires that follow the same rules as you do.

You start with two settlements and from there you can expand with more settlements in the wilderness if you want. The surroundings are totally empty except for terrain. If you do not see the point in establishing more settlements you can still explore the surroundings by sending scouts there. Eventually you will encounter scouts from neighbouring empires, they are controlled by an artificial intelligence and follow the same rules as you do and they have started from the same meagre two settlements background.

You can see the game as a competition between a couple of empires, your rating among the worlds empires could be read if you want to keep track of how you are doing. The game is rather open, with a couple of different strategies. Each empire have a range of preset choices to make that makes them better in some fields and not so in other. During play, your choice s on how to develop the settlements and what path in the civilization advances to explore makes every empire quite different from each other.

Warring is a large part of the game and it is conducted in battles when the troops of different empires meet on the map. The troops specifics are chosen by yourself and the choices of proficiency are given by your civilization advances and must also be supported by development of the settlements. Unless you progress in a very odd branch of the civilization tree you will have similar traits of your troops as the other empires.

A distinct aspect of the game is that the map is on two levels. The empires does not only cover the bright sunlit lands we are used too but there are also a dark netherworld. The Netherworld shares many terrain traits of the brightlands but the mountains are replaced with impassable stone with some tiny corridors that make up excellent defending posts.

Mostly tapping is used as an input method, long press is used for info, panning is used to navigate the map, but there is no pinching or other two finger gestures. There are different settings to influence the speed, based on the power of the device it is played on. It is released as a paid premium version and as a free version with advertisements on the screen.
title: Rising Empires

description:
GGG App is a compilation of numerous Android games from GirlsgoGames.

The contents as of December 26th 2013:

  • Meet Kitty
  • Secret Book
  • My Super Boyfriend
  • Rhino Rink
  • Happy Stacking
  • How do I Look? 2
  • Nutrush
  • Paws to Beauty 2
  • Paws to Beauty
  • Dream Pet Link
  • Dream Farm Link
  • Shoe Quiz 2
  • Devilish Dress
  • Magic Monster
  • Dream Love
  • Jewelry Quiz
  • Fabulous Fashion Dress Up
  • Party Dress Up
  • Antonio's Professional Make Up Artist
  • Find Your Love
  • Love Percentage
  • Princess Quiz
  • My Candy
  • Bee Romance 2
  • Restaurante Mexicana
  • Bubble Hit 2
  • Cupcake Jive
  • Candy Quiz
  • Perfect Manicure
  • Tower Jelley
title: GGG App

description:
In this quirky little puzzler, the player must guide ten newly hatched chicks to their home. The gameplay is in the spirit of Lemmings, with the chicks traipsing across the landscape until they hit an obstacle, and then turning tail and going back the way they came. However, unlike Lemmings, which relies on the player assigning tasks to each of the critters, Chicks requires players to manipulate the environment itself by placing springs or barriers in the proper locations. Doing so allows the chicks to traverse the entire landscape, hopping from platform to platform until they finally reach their destination. But be sure to avoid the chick-hungry snakes that inhabit some of the levels!

Chicks features 25 levels, each steadily increasing in difficulty. As in Angry Birds, players are awarded one to three stars if they complete a level. The number of stars indicate how well the player performed.
title: Chicks

description:
Galaxy Defense is a tower defense game with a sci-fi theme. In each level, the player must set up defense towers in pre-determined locations in order to defend his base against incoming waves of droids. There is a number of different kinds of towers, each with different strengths and weaknesses. The towers can be attacked and destroyed by the droids.

Destroying droids yields alloy which can be spent to buy or repair towers, or upgrade them to more powerful versions. The player can deploy several special weapons, e.g. an EMP which paralyzes droids, but each special weapon costs energy which is replenished slowly over time. After finishing a level, the player receives coins and diamonds, which can be spent between levels to buy various upgrades (e.g. more health for buildings, more maximum energy, etc.)

The player can purchase additional coins and diamonds for real money, or earn them by performing simple tasks (such as downloading and running a specific app, or watching a game trailer).

sample_screenshots.caption: A new type of tower is introduced.
A showcase of the available towers.

title: Galaxy Defense

description:
Coloroid is a puzzle game where the player attempts to fill the playfield with a single color. The playing field is divided into a number of rectangles of various colors; in the beginning, the top-left rectangle is marked with an outline. The player chooses a specific color from a list, and the outlined area expands to cover all rectangles it touches that are of this color. There is a limited number of moves to finish each level.

The player can freely choose the size of the board, the number of colors, and choose a rotating blocks option, which makes certain rectangles constantly change color.

sample_screenshots.caption: It gets harder on later levels
I decided to go with only three colors

title: Coloroid

description:
Drop is an action game where the player controls a falling ball, trying to get it to fall through holes in the platforms that block the way. The playfield is constantly scrolling down and if the ball ends up scrolled out of the screen, the game is over.

The only goal in the game is to get a high score. Points are gained by dropping through holes and collecting stars on the way.

sample_screenshots.caption: The background keeps transitioning between colors

title: Drop

description:
Friction Mobile is a puzzle game based on the Flash game Gimme Friction Baby. The player uses a rotating cannon to launch balls which bounce off the screen edges and other balls, and eventually come to a stop, at which point they grow as far as they can fit. When struck by a moving ball, a sphere already on the field loses a point of health; when it loses all three points, it disappears, and the player scores a point. The game is lost if the launched ball ends up falling beyond the dotted line at the bottom.

There are three modes of play available. In Arcade mode, the player is simply trying to get as many points as possible. The Level mode consist of several levels, where the player is challenged to get a specific number of points. In Fun mode, the player can set the movement speed of the ball and the cannon, and the balls simply bounce off the bottom line, making failure impossible.
title: Friction Mobile

description:
Red Stone is a sliding block puzzle game. The player must move tiles of various sizes around the board, in order to clear the way for the large, red tile and move it to the top-center location of the screen.

The game measures the time taken and the number of moves made by the player. It is possible to submit your high scores to an online ranking. There are several levels available, named after various minerals.
title: Red Stone

description:
Trap! is a game in the JezzBall vein. On each level, there are several balls bouncing around a playfield and the player must draw lines which grow slowly and wall off sections of the playfield when they reach the edges. To complete a level, a certain percentage of the playing area must be walled off. The player loses a life if a ball hits a line which is still growing.

Bonus items sometimes appear; the player can acquire them by walling them off. These include additional lives, timed powerups such as "ball freeze", or additional "speed powerups" which, when used, allow the player to construct a wall nearly instantaneously.

Upon finishing a level, the player sees a score breakdown; there are several factors that give the player various amounts of points.

There are additional game modes available: a "time challenge" mode where the player has limited time to complete a level and receives a time penalty when colliding with a ball, as well as "training" and "skill" mode which change the rules for gaining score and bonus items.

sample_screenshots.caption: Balls frozen in place by a powerup
Information about bonus score keeps popping up

title: Trap!

description:
Flee is based on LCD display handhelds of the 80's and 90's. The game revolves around a car driving along a road and has obstacles to avoid. The game has two game modes. In Mode A, the player controls the car and has to dodge obstacles. In mode B, the player controls the obstacles and has to moving them to prevent them from hitting the car.

The game contains 96 levels in total, and can be played in two speeds, normal and turbo. The game also features a global leaderboard.
title: Flee

description: 2 Pics 1 Answer is a simple puzzle game where the player has to figure out a word based on a set of two pictures along with audio hints. At the bottom of the screen a set of letters is shown (more than needed) to form the word. The game also shows of how many letters the answer consists. The game contains over 85 levels.
title: 2 Pics 1 Answer

description: In Bubble Pop Mania the player needs to pop bubbles by tapping or swiping through them to collect coins (1 point) and hearts (10 points). They appear from the screen from one of the sides in an underwater environment and need to be tapped before they disappear or points are lost. Bubbles with bombs and radioactive signs need to be avoided. There are also three types of power-ups, a clock that slows down bubble movement, a finger to enlarge the finger spot on the screen to pop more bubbles with one tap and a bomb to make bubbles explode.
title: Bubble Pop Mania

description: Pie is a puzzle game where the player controls a round being who is trying to get to a pie, but there are blocks and enemies in the way. Each block can be pushed once in a horizontal or vertical direction, provided there is an unoccupied space for it to be pushed into. Blocks change appearance after they have been pushed. The enemies look like red circles and move towards the player character when there is an open path. If a red enemy gets very close, it develops spikes. If a red enemy catches up to the player character, the player character dies and the level is reset. Players have an unlimited number of lives/attempts to solve a level. Levels can be reset without being caught by a red enemy. No scores are kept.
title: Pie

description:
Twisted Circus is a free-to-play game that mixes racing with platform elements. There are two game modes. In Gift all hidden gifts in a level need to be collected before time runs out. In Race the finish line has to be crossed before time runs out. Levels are side-scrolling 2D and movement is done automatically. The player interacts with two buttons, one to switch between the top and the bottom of the winding platforms and another one to jump. The latter is used to avoid falling down gaps and to land on new tracks. The tracks consists of different platforms usually with many gaps in between.

The game supports asynchronous multiplayer to race other people's ghosts. The initial version of the game includes 45 levels. Some characters are available at the beginning of the game and others need to be bought as an in-app purchase.
title: Twisted Circus

description: BMX Bike Ride & Run is a free-to-play BMX game. The goal is to avoid obstacles on your way to get the longest distance. The game includes several types of BMX bikes with different characteristics. They are unlocked in a shop spending a virtual currency earned by catching gold coins and doing stunts. The gameplay is based on a two-finger mechanism: touching the right side of the screen is used to jump and the left side is used to switch between the three paths on the track. Stunts are performed by shaking the device and the bike goes forward automatically.
title: BMX Bike Ride & Run

description:
Twisty is a Z-code interpreter for Android devices that comes with four Z-code games included and can run any others you are able to migrate on to your device. Included games are:* Adventure

  • Anchorhead* Curses
  • Violet
title: Twisty

description:
This is an emulator of multiple text adventure virtual machines, allowing play of games written in Z-code and with TADS. In addition to supporting such games players can figure out how to introduce to their device's ecosystem, it comes with built-in capability to download and play the following games:* 9:05,

  • Adventure,
  • Bronze,
  • Indigo,
  • Lost Pig,
  • Shade,
  • The Awakening,
  • The Dreamhold,
  • The Plant,
  • Theatre,
  • and Unnkulian Underworld: The Unknown Adventure.
title: Son of Hunky Punk

description:
Cestos is an online multiplayer game based around one-on-one matches. Both players start with an equal number of marbles (two or three, depending on the map) on the playfield, and must eliminate all of the opponent's marbles. Each turn, both players choose the angle and strength with which to push each of their balls, then both confirm their choices and watch the outcome. There are six maps available, and the exact rules vary slightly between them; on most levels, the players eliminate the opponent's marbles by shoving them into pits, and marbles leave behind landmines every time they are moved. A mine explodes when rolled into and pushes marbles away.

The maps included are:

  • Black Hole - a simple map with a single large pit in the middle.
  • Stoplight - the map features five pits, which keep opening and closing throughout the match.
  • Minefield - the map contains no pits; instead, marbles are destroyed when they hit a mine five times.
  • Speedball - a map where the marbles move at double speed.
  • Sumo - a map where the marbles don't leave behind landmines, and the focus is on shoving the balls against each other.
  • Islands - a map made up of two unconnected platforms, one for each player, where the goal is just to keep your balls from falling off your platform before the opponents' do.

The game offers a system of achievements (called "feats") which reward the player with ways to customize the appearance of his avatar, as well as a friend system and an in-game chat.

sample_screenshots.caption: Map selection screen. This one is easily the most popular.
Looks like we're on the losing side
There aren't a lot of people online, it seems.

title: Cestos

description:
Epic Ball Game: Space Soccer is an air hockey variation where the player touches the ball directly instead of controlling it by a paddle. The AI is represented by a lively 3D character. The game contains weapons and tricks to help and prevent making a score.

There are three game modes:* Singleplayer containing 20 levels of progressive difficulty;

  • Online multiplayer over the Internet;
  • Two players on the same device.

Space Soccer contains global leaderboards (singleplayer and multiplayer separately), Facebook and Twitter integration. Players can invite each other for online combat directly from leaderboards via push notifications.
title: Epic Ball Game: Space Soccer

description: Scrambled Net is an Android port of the Linux game KNetWalk. In this puzzle game the player must connect all the terminals to a central server, by rotating tiles with sections of wire to connect their ends. There are five difficulty levels available. The first three change the board size, while the latter two introduce different play rules: on the Master level, the wires must also connect across the wraparound edges of the playfield; on the Insane level, sections of wire with three or four connections are invisible.

sample_screenshots.caption: The third difficulty level; a skilled player can still complete it in about 90 seconds.
"Master" difficulty level. This can be significantly harder as you can't work off the edges.
The simplest difficulty level. It can be completed in less than half a minute if you're good.

title: Scrambled Net

description: In Rescue Pilot you're steering a horizontal-scrolling rescue helicopter to gather casualties and return them to safety. There are several mission types like casualty rescue, fire fighting and water rescue which need to be accomplished against the clock. The aircraft can be controlled either by tilting the phone or by the direction of touch. The game itself is free-to-play, but you can buy in-app-upgrades e.g. for an improved military helicopter.
title: Rescue Pilot

description:
Sudoku 10'000 is a comprehensive Sudoku game with 15000+ Sudoku puzzles of many levels (from "Very Easy" to "Nightmare") and variants: X-Sudoku, Jigsaw, Centerdot, etc. The game allows pencil marks, coloring of cells, and can provide hints (with a graphical step-by-step explanation of the logic behind each move). You can also add you own puzzles from scratch, that can be then analysed and solved by an user or by the applet itself. The user interface is also highly customizable (fonts, borders, input methods, etc.). Additional puzzles can be downloaded from the developer's website, adding "Beyond Nightmare" puzzles.

The game is available in six variations: Sudoku 10'000*: free + advertisements

  • Sudoku 10'000 Free: free + advertisements
  • Sudoku 10'000 Bronze: commercial + no advertisements
  • Sudoku 10'000 Silver: commercial + advertisements + extra puzzles
  • Sudoku 10'000 Gold: commercial + no advertisements + extra puzzles
  • Sudoku 10'000 Plus: commercial + no advertisements + extra puzzles

It is possible to upgrade using in-app purchases.
title: Sudoku 10'000

description: Silpheed Alternative AM is a third-person space combat game, exclusively for Android devices and part of Game Art's long running Silpheed franchise. It is set in a distant future where the United Earth Command is struck by a surprise attack by an unknown alien species. The player takes control of a ship in the Gungnir Squadron and has to repel the alien attackers over the course of an 10-mission campaign, with the ability to purchase weapons and ship upgrades in between missions. There are three control options, either dual on-screen analog sticks, gyroscope or an Xperia Play compatible internal or external gamepad.
title: Silpheed Alternative AM

description: Dibidogs: Pipediver is a reaction based game where the character flies through different kinds of pipes seen from a third-person view. Inside these pipes the character faces obstacles he should avoid and depending of the game mode, some collectibles may appear on the way as well. The game is built around the elements from The Dibidogs television series world, yet it is not a story-driven game and doesn't as such connect to the storyline of the series.
title: Dibidogs: Pipediver

description:
In Icepop Showdown you're a businessman on a lunch break in the park and spotting a lady sitting on the bench. In order to get acquainted with her, you buy her ice pops from a nearby ice cream truck.

Icepop Showdown is a one-button game where your goal is to aim for the highest score by feeding the lady ice pops before the timer runs out. You get chains by feeding her multiple ice pops in a row, as well as getting coins from each one she eats, which you can use to purchase a variety of other ice pops.
title: Icepop Showdown

description:
Arrow Slider is a sliding tiles puzzle game. Each level consists of a grid of tiles with arrows on them. Tap on the arrows to slide a row or column in the direction of that arrow. The object of the game is to arrange the tiles like the goal layout, as displayed at the bottom of the screen.

The game is based on the freeware Windows game Arrow Slider. The Android version has a few new features. Grid tiles can be empty so the levels are not all just rectangles. There are grey circle tiles which cannot be tapped but must also be moved to certain positions. The game has several predefined levels which can be selected in a level select screen, they can be solved in any order.

sample_screenshots.caption: Aaargh, okay this level is insanely difficult
Level 4 is the classic 4x4 horizontal layout
Tiles can also be empty, this allows more interesting levels than just rectangles

title: Arrow Slider

description:
Sir Dashing follows the side-scrolling adventure of the eponymous hero, a handsome cartoon of a Mallory-esque knight, in his quest to save his beloved princess from an abducting ogre.

The game follows a set track, comprising three different environments, that Sir Dashing follows on his steed, in hot pursuit of the chartreuse princess-thief. Obstacles can either be jumped over by swiping the screen, or dashed through by tapping the screen. Some obstacles only allow for one of these solution. Rocks, for instance, cannot be shattered with a dash. The game follows a set track that Sir Dashing follows on his steed. Obstacles can either be jumped over by swiping the screen, or dashed through by tapping the screen. Some obstacles only allow for one of these solution. Rocks, for instance, cannot be shattered with a dash. There are several items that can be collected throughout the game: cakes which the princess has tossed behind the path of her fleeing kidnapper, and coins which can be used to upgrade Sir Dashing's appearance.

sample_screenshots.caption: That bouncing cake will heal some damage.

title: Sir Dashing

description:
Pocket Wizard: Magic Fantasy! follows a young mage on her quest to become the Croesus pixel world. Fortunately she has a magical protective barrier that no monster, no matter how great of size can breach. And killing monsters is a sure way to make money! Her avarice knows know limit, and the monster supply is endless, by combining these facts with shrewd investment a wizard can make a pretty penny in no time.

Gameplay consists of the magical heroine walking to the right as the background scrolls by, repeating every few seconds or so. Monsters continually wander up to attack, and are repelled by a magical forcefield around the character. There is no way to die, or lose. As monster approach or stumble away from the forcefield they can be destroyed with a magical wand shot. No aiming is required, just tapping the screen automatically damages monsters. Magic skills load over time, which require the player to enter a series of directional inputs that result in a more devastating and longer lasting attack. Each monster earned gives a set amount of coins. After intervals larger boss monsters will appear that can be converted into larger sums of coins.

The money collected can be used to upgrade either weapons, magic, investments, or treasures. The weapons result in more money being made from killing monsters, as well as increasing the speed at which they can be destroyed. The magics require increasingly long combinations of directional inputs to execute but offer new visuals and longer lasting kill times. Investments, in various institutions such as schools, will pay dividends continuously ever few seconds to the players overall amount of money. Treasures increase the amount of money or effectiveness of the other categories.

Every few hours the player can open a treasure chest to receive a random amount of money. There is no final goal to the game other than to increase the money or points of the heroine and all gameplay continues indefinitely.

sample_screenshots.caption: That long-necked giraffayena is in for a frigid surprise!
A description of our heroine's blithe attitude to her violent path to wealth.

title: Pocket Wizard: Magic Fantasy!

description:
Nonograms Katana is a "paint by number" style game, where the player must recreate a picture in a grid by filling in cells, with the help of clues which tell about the lengths of groups of filled cells in each row and column.

The game comes with several hundred built-in puzzles. Apart from filling in cells, the player can mark cells with crosses or dots. Puzzles can be zoomed in or out, and moved around. The player can ask for up to 15 hints, each hint uncovering one filled cell. There is an auto-fill option, where filling in all the cells in a row or column marks all remaining cells as empty.

The paid "VIP" version of the game (bought with in-app purchases) comes with no ads, and the option to show the answer to a puzzle instantly.

sample_screenshots.caption: Larger puzzles are easier when zoomed in.
Helpful numbers show up when drawing a line, to show you how many cells you have filled.
After a succesful solution, the game shows you the picture you've just uncovered.
The puzzle selection menu. Already solved puzzles are visible.

title: Nonograms Katana

description:
Peg Solitaire Saga is an adaptation of Peg Solitaire, with mischievously smiling green balls taking on the role of pegs. The goal is to clear out the board, removing pegs by jumping other pegs over them. There are two modes available, Saga or Classic.

In Saga mode, the player completes the levels in sequence. To complete a level and unlock the next board, there must be no more than three pegs remaining once there are no available moves left. On some levels, the player must leave the pegs in specific squares on the board.

The Classic mode offers a number of board shapes, and the goal is to gain a high score by removing as many pegs as possible in the fewest moves.

sample_screenshots.caption: A more favorable rating. Note the fireworks.
To win this level, you not only need to remove a given number of pegs, the remaining pegs must be on specific squares (different squares, depending on how many pegs are left.)

title: Peg Solitaire Saga

description:
Real Nonogram is a paint-by-numbers game, where the player must reveal a picture by filling in grid cells, based on numerical clues to the sides of the grid. There is a number of puzzles included, with varying sizes, and sometimes with more than one color. While solving, the player can zoom the board in and out and move it around. An online high score board keeps track of people who finished specific puzzles in the fastest time. An editor is included that allows creating and saving own puzzles, as well as submit them to the developer for possible inclusion in the program.

The game includes in-game ads, both banners and ads which occasionally cover the screen, which can be removed for a fee.

sample_screenshots.caption: In-game help gives some basics on solving nonograms
One of the earliest, tutorial levels. See how the cells look like scribbled in, similarly to a real nonogram puzzle, as opposed to regular black squares.
Designing our own puzzle. Don't laugh.

title: Real Nonogram

description:
Peg Solitaire is an adaptation of the board game. It comes with 11 "classic" board layouts, and allows the player to create his own boards. The goal is to remove all but one pegs from the board, by jumping over them with neighboring pegs.

The game contains undo and redo options, as well as the ability to see if the current layout has a solution. When a board is successfully cleared, the player is informed about how much time he needed to solve the puzzle, but the game doesn't keep track of high scores. There are in-game ad banners present.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game congratulates you even if you fail miserably.
The menu with 11 classic boards that appears after starting the game. There is no title screen.
Games currently in progress can be resumed in this section.
Making my way through one of the boards. The red peg is the selected one.

title: Peg Solitaire

description:
Peg Solitaire is an adaptation of the titular game. The player must clear the board of pegs, eliminating them by jumping over them with other pegs. Several board variants are available, with both square and triangular shapes. On some boards, the player must leave the last peg in a specific spot on the board to win.

The game includes an automatic solution feature, which attempts to find a solution for the current board setup. It's also possible to create and play custom boards. The game keeps track of high scores (solutions with the fastest completion time and the least moves.)

In-game ads are present, both in the form of banners, and ads which sometimes pop up and cover the entire screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: On this board, the last peg must be left in the middle hole.
Playing the "Classic" layout. The purple peg is the one selected, which we can move to the yellow hole.
A triangle-shaped board, where each peg has six neighbors instead of four.

title: Peg Solitaire

description:
Crystal Boy is a simple action game with a retro, NES-style look and feel. The player controls Crystal Boy, who flies up into the sky to collect crystals, but must avoid traps and flying ravens, as colliding with these means a game over. The protagonist can be moved left and right with on-screen controls that mimic console controls.

To gain score, the player must collect crystals, and fruits for bonus points. It's also possible to find a star which makes Crystal Boy grow to three times his size to destroy traps in his way, but collision with a raven makes a giant Boy become small again. It is possible to choose music from the player's library to play in-game.

The game was originally released as part of the compilation PicoPicoGames.

sample_screenshots.caption: Up in the air. You can move the hero with the left and right buttons of the onscreen D-pad. The rest of the buttons are for show and don't do anything.
The end. We ran into some spikes.

title: Crystal Boy

description:
Griddlers Plus is a nonogram (paint-by-numbers) game, where the player must recreate a picture by filling out cells in a grid, based on numeric clues. The game comes with a large number of puzzles with various board sizes; it also supports colored puzzles (with more colors than black and white), diagonal squares (cells with two colors separated diagonally), triangle puzzles (with triangle-shaped boards) and "multi griddlers" which consist of multiple parts, each solved separately.

While solving, the player can ask for hints, up to ten per the puzzle being solved; each hint reveals one filled cell or corrects one mistake. Undo and redo options are also available. It is possible to zoom the grid in or out, and move it around.

Griddlers Plus also includes a search feature to find puzzles by title, and a built-in editor. The game contains ad banners.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the "multi griddlers", with multiple parts.
Using a hint to find out the location of a cell.
One of the bigger puzzles in the game being worked on. Each square in this picture is actually a 15x15 dot puzzle!
The picture is shown after a succesful solution.

title: Griddlers Plus

description:
Smash is a Breakout clone, where the player must bounce a ball to destroy bricks and keep it from falling off the bottom of the screen. The paddle is controlled with the touchscreen; the player can drag his finger to move the paddle, or tap the screen to quickly move the paddle there. There are two game modes, Challenge and Arcade. Challenge mode contains 120 levels divided into 6 "galaxies", and clearing out all bricks on a level unlocks the next one. The Arcade mode consists of a single level, with new bricks constantly appearing at the top of the screen, and the only goal to accumulate as much score as possible before a game over.

As usual in Breakout games, the playfield contains bricks of various types, which need a varying number of hits to be destroyed. There are also bonuses dropping down from destroyed bricks, such as multiple balls, temporary lengthening of the paddle, or creating a barrier at the bottom of the screen. Other things dropping down include harmful pickups which shorten the paddle or make it move backwards, and "M" points. The latter can be spent to buy upgrades that increase the number of lives available on a level, or improve the function of the bonus pickups.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game over - no more lives. Here, have an in-game ad for your trouble.
Later levels have more of the sturdy bricks that require several shots, and often have unbreakable gray bricks to make the playfield more awkward.
Several balls bouncing around, thanks to multi-ball powerups.

title: Smash

description:
Missile Panic is an action game where the player controls a missile and on each level must destroy several "cores" by flying into them. The missile constantly flies forward and can be turned in four directions, using on-screen controls, but cannot instantly turn 180 degrees. Colliding with a wall destroys the missile and means a game over; there is also a time limit to every level. The speed of the missile increases whenever it picks up an energy power-up or destroys a core.

Destroying a core causes the missile to lose one unit of energy, and if energy runs out while some cores remain intact, the level ends in failure. Energy can be replenished by collecting colorful balloons, and if energy is already full, the energy bar increases. Another bonus is the recovery flag, which restores the missile speed and energy to full and resets the time limit.

The game was originally released as part of the compilation PicoPicoGames.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another level, with more cores, and with three colorful balloon bonuses that replenish energy.
End of level 1. We get a score bonus for getting a good time.
Beginning of the game. The A and B buttons are cosmetic, the only ones that matter are the D-pad buttons.
About to grab a balloon bonus to get back one unit of energy.

title: Missile Panic

description:
Pony Killer is an action fangame, or maybe a hater-game, with characters from the TV cartoon My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. The player controls a space soldier (looking just like the Master Chief from Halo), who must massacre ponies that run down a rainbow path. The player can move the soldier up and down, and shoot, with on-screen controls. If any pony manages to get to the right edge of the screen, the game is over.

There is a limited amount of ammunition in the player's gun, but killing a pony replenishes an unit of ammo, and as the player kills more ponies, the amount of ammunition grows. The more ponies are killed, the better the rating becomes that is shown at the bottom of the screen; example ratings include "First Pony Blood", "Pontastic Kill", "Pony Killer of the Month", etc.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game in progress, with a fairly high score.
Starting instructions for a first-time player

title: Pony Killer

description:
Pico Pico Puzzle is a puzzle game where, on each level, the player needs to help several soldiers escape a dungeon. Soldiers can be moved in four directions, one tile at a time, and all of them move simultaneously in the same direction. A soldier doesn't move if he's against a wall or another obstacle. To finish a level, all tiles with keys on them must be occupied by soldiers, with no other soldiers left.

There are many obstacles and dangers on the later levels. Water and pitfalls kill soldiers who run into them, monsters block soldiers unless you pick up a sword, bottles and blue balls need to be pushed around, cracked floor gives way if passed over too many times, arrows allow soldiers to only walk in one direction over them.

There are 64 levels, with later levels unlocked by completing earlier ones. However, the game does not save the player's progress, meaning that the player must unlock all levels from the beginning with each play session.

The game was originally released as part of the compilation PicoPicoGames.

sample_screenshots.caption: Gonna need to reshape this groupof soldiers
Can't pass through monsters unless you have swords. And there are more soldiers than keys, so some must perish

title: Pico Pico Puzzle

description:
Chess allows to play the board game against a computer or against another human player. It is based on the developer's own chess AI engine, "Treebeard".

The game offers numerous options, such as: a variety of graphical themes for the pieces and the board, activate a time limit for a move or for the entire game, play with a handicap (remove one white piece), and 12 levels of difficulty for the computer opponent. There are two play modes, Casual and Pro; Casual offers a number of features that make the game easier for beginners, such as the option to show pieces that are in danger and unprotected, a "chess tutor" which recommends which piece to move, or a "show CPU thinking" option which shows what moves the AI is considering. The game keeps tracks of past game results.

The game comes in both a paid version, and an ad-supported free version.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Black bishop has just made a move. Now I'm moving my Knight
One of the possible skins for the pieces is based on the medieval "Lewis chessmen"
We're nearing the end of the match. Here, an alternative skins was chosen for the board and for the pieces
You can review the game so far

title: Chess

description:
GunDiver is an action game with a side view, where the player controls an armed diver, who is not affected by gravity and can be moved in any direction, at any angle. The protagonist is moved and shoots with on-screen controls, which mimic the D-pad and A-button of a classic console. To complete each level, the diver must destroy all the immobile monsters and reach the exit, while avoiding the enemies' attacks. Some monsters shoot fireballs, others generate weaker but mobile monsters. On later levels, colliding with the walls is harmful. Each level must be finished before the air runs out (which functions as a time limit.)

Killed monsters leave behind power-ups, such as life-restoring hearts, speed boost or a gun upgrade. The game is over if the player runs out of health or air.

The game was originally released as part of the compilation PicoPicoGames.

sample_screenshots.caption: With our gun upgraded, we blast the fireball-spamming pink monsters. The blue walls are deadly to the touch.
Several of the speed boost powerups await us.
A heart powerup. It heals one life bar, or gives a bonus life bar if our health is full.

title: GunDiver

description:
Real Einstein's Riddle is a puzzle game, based on a logic puzzle called "Zebra Puzzle" or "Einstein's Puzzle". The puzzle involves multiple persons -- each of which has a different occupation, likes a different drink, owns a different pet, etc. -- and the player must figure out all the characteristics of all the individuals. To help in this, the player is given a set of clues such as "The painter drinks Coffee" or "The Englishman isn't named Louis". There are four difficulty levels, each with a different number of people and their traits. Each difficulty level contains 80 puzzles.

During the gameplay, a table is shown with each column corresponding to a particular person's traits, and each cell containing several icons that represent possible choices. The player can turn the icons on and off to narrow down a person's given trait, eventually choosing one right option once he is sure of his choice. Hints can be read one-by-one, but the player can also "shelve" a hint he no longer needs to keep it from showing up, and can use a "filter" option to only view the hints that mention specific characteristics.

The game contains ad banners that can be turned off for a fee.

sample_screenshots.caption: This Extreme-level puzzle may take you a lot of time.
A puzzle from the Hard difficulty. One hint has been just Shelved because we no longer need it.
You can choose to only view hints that mention specific drinks, hats, etc.

title: Real Einstein's Riddle

description:
The legend of PicoHERO is a simple, short RPG game with a Zelda-like real-time gameplay and NES-styled graphics. To save the fairyland, the PicoHERO must defeat "Satan's shadow". The hero can be moved in four directions with the on-screen controls, and can attack monsters by running into them.

The hero has three attributes--life, strength and defense. Experience points are gained by killing monsters, and reaching a limit of experience points grants a level up, increasing strength, defense and maximum life points. There are a number of items to pick up: potions which restore life to maximum, keys to open doors, a glove to move rocks, sword and shield to improve attributes, and jewels necessary to defeat the shadow. Apart from monsters, the player is threatened by fire pits that cause major damage when the hero stands nearby.

The game was originally released as part of the compilation PicoPicoGames.

sample_screenshots.caption: Investigating some tunnels. The monsters may look unfriendly but the fireball is the true threat. Like in many other games from this series, the A and B buttons don't do anything.
Beginning of the game, in some kind of a walled-off forest. Several green slimes threaten us. A healing potion sits near.
Found a key, and one of the jewels in a forest, but it's inaccessible.

title: The legend of PicoHERO

description:
Word Snake is a crossword game, but instead of the words running in a single direction, they change direction with the first 2 letters starting going down, with the next 3 going diagonal and the last 2 going up, changing, with several words potentially overlapping. Once the player has found each word, the player must drag their finger over the complete word. There are several words on each puzzle, with the length and number of words depending on the difficulty selected.

There are a number of different categories of words available, each of which is in a variety of different languages. There is also an online leaderboard that tracks the best times of players by their Google+ account, as well as in game achievements.

sample_screenshots.caption: Two down, five left to find

title: Word Snake

description:
Peg Solitaire is a digital version of the board game of the same name, in which the goal is to remove all the pegs from the board by jumping over pegs with one of the neighbouring pegs. In this version, however, the pegs are substituted with marbles.

There are no extra game modes featured aside from the basic version. However, the five best times are tracked locally on the device it is installed on, and there is also the Spanish language option.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game in progress. The currently selected marble appears yellow.

title: Peg Solitaire

description: MinerMan is a casual arcade game inspired by the mine cart segments from Donkey Kong 64. You ride down into the mine slowly increasing in speed while collecting gold nuggets. Tap on the lanes to switch lanes as fast as possible to avoid colliding into other mine carts. Avoid getting distracted by bats or your surroundings, or you are bound to crash, as you go faster and faster to a high pace arcade game.
title: MinerMan

description:
Race The Traffic is a street racing game in which the player can compete with AI drivers whilst avoiding the surrounding traffic during day or night. During the race, players earn points and coins. They are earned by driving as fast as possible and successfully dodging cars. The points can then be used to buy new, faster cars. Cars each have different statistics for speed, handling and brakes.

The game can be controlled through tilt, touch or on-screen buttons. Races take place on tracks that are entirely straight. The goal is usually to avoid traffic by going left and right, or slowing down. There is a time limit in the endless mode to reach a certain distance and the car can only sustain a limited amount of damage. The three game modes are endless one-way, endless two-way and one on one. It possible to switch between various perspectives while racing.
title: Race The Traffic

description:
LogicKingdom is a color nonogram puzzle game where the aim is to reveal a picture in a grid. This is done by reading the number clues on the top and side of the picture which will tell the player how many cells will be filled and left out and which color should be used. The game is fairly straightforward with just one screen of puzzles to solve and the ability to quick save in the middle of a puzzle in case the player has to stop playing before he/she is done. Once a puzzle is solved, the picture will be revealed on the puzzle selection screen. All of the puzzles are of the same size (15x15 cells), so the game's difficulty never increases unlike many games of the genre.

The Android version of the game features 100 puzzles to solve, while the iOS version adds an additional 100 puzzles from LogicKingdom2.

sample_screenshots.caption: Once a puzzle is solved, the full picture is displayed along with a text telling you what it is (in some cases it is needed to make sense of it).
The puzzle selection screen. Only a few puzzles solved so far.

title: LogicKingdom

description:
LogicKingdom2 is the second game in the LogicKingdom series of nonogram puzzles. The game is identical to the first one in terms of look and gameplay, but features 100 new puzzles to solve.

The game is a color nonogram puzzle game where the aim is to reveal a picture in a grid. This is done by reading the number clues on the top and side of the picture which will tell the player how many cells will be filled and left out and which color should be used. The game is fairly straightforward with just one screen of puzzles to solve and the ability to quick save in the middle of a puzzle in case the player has to stop playing before he/she is done. Once a puzzle is solved, the picture will be revealed on the puzzle selection screen. All of the puzzles are of the same size (15x15 cells), so the game's difficulty never increases unlike many games of the genre.

sample_screenshots.caption: Solving a puzzle and getting a strange Beatles vibe...
-SPOILER WARNING- The puzzle gallery with all the puzzles solved and some lovely engrish to go along with it.
Solved the puzzle. We all live in a yellow submarine!

title: LogicKingdom2

description:
LogicKingdom3 is the third game in the LogicKingdom series of nonogram puzzles. The game is identical to the first two in terms of look and gameplay, but features 100 new puzzles to solve as well as an additional 100 black&white puzzles.

The game is a color nonogram puzzle game where the aim is to reveal a picture in a grid. This is done by reading the number clues on the top and side of the picture which will tell the player how many cells will be filled and left out and which color should be used. The game is fairly straightforward with just one screen of puzzles to solve and the ability to quick save in the middle of a puzzle in case the player has to stop playing before he/she is done. Once a puzzle is solved, the picture will be revealed on the puzzle selection screen. All of the puzzles are of the same size (15x15 cells), so the game's difficulty never increases unlike many games of the genre.

sample_screenshots.caption: -SPOILERS- This is the puzzle selection menu for the color puzzles with all puzzles solved and some lovely engrish to go along with it.

title: LogicKingdom3

description:
Oekaki-kun ~Nyūmon-hen~ is a nonogram game where the goal of the game is to reveal a picture in a grid by using number clues along the sides. The numbers lets the player know how many cells should be filled in groups, which color as well as which should be left untouched entirely.

The game features 24 puzzles to solve, 12 of which are in color and 12 which are black&white. There is also a gallery where the full pictures can be viewed once they have been solved.

sample_screenshots.caption: Almost done with another colorful puzzle.

title: Oekaki-kun ~Nyūmon-hen~

description:
Chess Fusion is a digital version of the traditional board game of chess. It features 3D graphics that allow the player to rotate the board, as well as set it to a given angle looking down on the board.

The game features a single game mode against a standard adjustable level AI, but when the device Chess Fusion is being played on is connected to the internet, players can take advantage of the games smart cloud AI, with can be adjusted to a specific ELO chess skill rating, with the minimum setting of 800 (the level of a novice) up to 2400 (which is the level of a professional chess player). In addition to the two AI settings, there is a two player mode available on a single device, or two devices over the internet.

There are three board/piece designs that can be chosen before each game commences.
title: Chess Fusion

description: Pixel Runner is a 2D side-scrolling platform game. The protagonist, a human-like aggregation of pixels, moves rightwards and needs to avoid still and moving obstacles (missiles, barriers, …). The progression can't be halted. Available actions are jumping, double jumping, and a spinning attack that makes us able to pass through barriers. There are bonuses, which grant temporary invulnerability, slow advancement, or even force acceleration, for some seconds, and two game modes: an arcade mode, lasting until we survive and presenting random obstacles, and a mode based on set levels.
title: Pixel Runner

description:
Apparatus is a puzzle game similar to the Incredible Machine series. The goal of each level is to guide one or multiple marbles into the goal. The way to achieve this is by using the limited amount of tools - e.g. planks, motors or ropes - to build contraptions and chain reactions. Especially later in the game, the player is required to experiment in order to beat the levels. The chain reaction can be started at any time to see what happens and there is an undone feature. Unlike similar games, there is no time limit and no points to earn by using less items.

The included editor can be used to experiment without boundaries or to create new puzzles. Those can be uploaded on the community site for other players to try. It is also possible to edit already beaten levels.
title: Apparatus

description:
Project Trinity is a single-player, physics-based, action game. Players take on the role of defense officer at a secret research base hidden in an asteroid field. The Humans are losing a war against the Antarans and the research base is developing a weapon to turn the tables. The player has control of a prototype of this weapon, a device that can manipulate gravity at great distances, and must use it to protect the station from Antaran forces while assisting Human supply ships attempting to deliver materials to the station. This is accomplished by monitoring the station's radar for incoming ships and using it to view the ships from a top down perspective as they traverse the asteroid field toward the station.

During a mission the player can touch the screen to create a gravity well at that location, pulling nearby asteroids toward its center. Using this technique, the player engages in two types of gameplay: deflecting asteroids from the path of incoming supply ships, or hurling asteroids at Antaran raiders. Destroying the Antaran ships can be a challenge, as they use AI to dodge out of the way and return fire with a variety of weapons systems.

sample_screenshots.caption: Spend Upgradium stolen from Antaran ships on any of 8 upgrade paths.
The player reads about Human Corvettes while keeping an eye on approaching ships with the station's radar.
The player attempts to rescue a badly damaged Combat Search and Rescue vessel.
The Antarans send a member of the legendary Vega class against the station. The player scrambles to deal damage as the warship obliterates everything in its path.
The player uses a gravity well to pull a massive asteroid out of the path of an incoming Bristol class cargo ship.

title: Project Trinity

description: Named after the first magic word in the history of text adventures, this Android program is an interpreter for platform-independent Z-code games, primarily of the interactive fiction variety. It comes bundled with Graham Nelson's game Curses, but can run most any other Z-code game users are able to migrate on to their devices.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game list (interpreter ships with one game bundled, Curses; players add their own selections.)
Curses start screen w/ on-screen keyboard.

title: Xyzzy

description: This program bundles three early text adventure games for the TRS-80 Color Computer (or CoCo for short): Bedlam, Raaka-Tu, and Pyramid 2000.
title: CoCo Text Adventures

description:
Sheep Battle is a hybrid between Minesweeper and the board game Battleship. The player is given a field which is split into cells, several of which are hiding sheep. It is up to the player to find them and kill them.

There are various weapons available, including a pistol, machine gun, flamethrower and grenades, and all the sheep need to be killed before running out of ammunition. As the player completes more games, they will level up and earn new weapons.
